structure.unit: Regulations And By Laws Relative To Ways And Bridges

law.catch_line: Leading, Driving, Or Conveying Dangerous Wild Animals On Public Ways
law.text: Whoever leads or drives a bear or other dangerous wild animal or causes it to travel upon or be conveyed over a public way unless properly secured in some covered vehicle or cage shall be punished by a fine of not less than five nor more than twenty dollars. Any such animal which is found upon a public way not so secured or caged may be killed by a sheriff, constable or police officer.
